intro: Peristrophe strigosa, commonly known as the rough peristrophe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Peristrophe strigosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of ecological study.
